DOC.brief_title: Antimicrobial Solution Saline Solution Maintaining Catheter Patency Preventing Catheter-Related Blood Infections Patients With Malignancies
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To evaluate safety antimicrobial catheter lock solution comprise trimethoprim-sulfamethoxazole , edetate calcium disodium ( EDTA ) , ethanol versus saline solution patient malignancy . - To compare efficacy lock solution versus saline solution maintain catheter patency patient . - To demonstrate superiority lock solution prevent reduce incidence catheter-related bloodstream infection patient long-term indwelling catheter . OUTLINE : This multicenter study . Patients stratify accord clinical site randomize 1 2 intervention arm . - Arm I : Patients receive antimicrobial solution central peripheral venous catheter ( CVC PVC ) daily 90 day . Catheter dwell time 1-24 hour . The catheter flush drug infusion blood aspiration . - Arm II : Patients receive saline solution CVC PVC daily 90 day . Catheter dwell time 1-24 hour . The catheter flush drug infusion blood aspiration . After completion study , patient follow 10 day .
